intro: Centaurea pelia var. gerania, commonly known as the Geranium centaurea, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces seed heads that are distinctive in appearance. This variety is valued for its ornamental qualities and is often used in gardens and landscapes.
